entities.name: he
entities.description: The protagonist of the story, referred to as 'he' throughout the passage.

entities.name: Disillusionment Charm
entities.description: A magical charm that hides the user from their own eyes, mentioned in the first paragraph.

entities.name: castle
entities.description: The beloved castle of the protagonist, his 'first kingdom' and 'birthright', described as being beside the lake.

entities.name: lake
entities.description: A body of water where the castle is located, mentioned in the second paragraph.

entities.name: tomb
entities.description: A white marble tomb that is an 'unnecessary blot' on the familiar landscape, described as being beside the lake.

entities.name: yew wand
entities.description: An old yew wand used by the protagonist to cast spells, mentioned in the third paragraph.

entities.name: Wandmaker
entities.description: The creator of the yew wand, mentioned as 'The Wandmaker' in the fourth paragraph.

relationships.description: The protagonist uses the Disillusionment Charm to hide himself from his own eyes.
The protagonist owns or has a connection to the castle, which is described as his 'first kingdom' and 'birthright'.
The lake is located beside the castle, where the protagonist walks.
The protagonist feels a sense of purpose in destroying the tomb, which he sees as an 'unnecessary blot' on the landscape.
The protagonist uses the yew wand to cast spells, including the one that destroys the tomb.
The Wandmaker created the yew wand, which is used by the protagonist.
